prompts.title: Update parcel type to include 'delivered_at' field
prompts.system: You are a senior software engineer working with a React and TypeScript codebase. Your task is to update type definitions to ensure type safety.

context.prdSummary: The RedX Admin Hub is a web application designed for administrative users of the RedX platform. Its primary purpose is to manage and oversee various operations related to parcel delivery services.
relevantRepoConventions: File Naming: Uses camelCase for files and PascalCase for components.
tokensOrConstraints: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
evidence: Ensure type safety by updating the parcel type definition to include the new 'delivered_at' field.

instructions: Add 'delivered_at' field to Parcel type in src/types/parcel.ts
Ensure the new field is optional if not always present
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers
deliverables: 'delivered_at' field is present in Parcel type definition

prompts.title: Modify parcel API to include 'delivered_at' field

context.prdSummary: The RedX Admin Hub is a web application designed for administrative users of the RedX platform. Its primary purpose is to manage and oversee various operations related to parcel delivery services.
tokensOrConstraints: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
evidence: The API must provide the 'delivered_at' data for it to be displayed in the UI.

instructions: Update API request to ensure 'delivered_at' is included in the response
Test API response to confirm 'delivered_at' is received
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers
Use existing API client for requests

context.prdSummary: The RedX Admin Hub is a web application designed for administrative users of the RedX platform. Its primary purpose is to manage and oversee various operations related to parcel delivery services.
relevantRepoConventions: Prefer Ant Design components for consistent UI patterns.
tokensOrConstraints: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
evidence: Display the 'Delivered At' information to users as per the new feature requirements.

instructions: Add 'Delivered At' column to the table in src/pages/Parcels.tsx
Ensure the column displays 'Not Delivered' if data is not available
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope
